title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Licensing of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Licensing of 

Drivers) (Amendment) (No. 6) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited road traffic (licensing drivers) (amendment) (no 6) regulation 2020

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: 2. Regulation 41 of the Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) Regulations
text_raw:
2. Regulation 41 of the Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 
2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006) shall apply to an application by a person for a driving 
licence or a learner permit made during the period beginning on 1 August 2020 
and ending on 31 December 2020, subject to the modification that paragraph (1) 
(d) of that Regulation shall not operate or have effect during that period. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

29 July, 2020. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 31st July, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [265] 3

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 
2006 to provide that persons of 70 years or older (except those with an 
identified/specified illness) applying for a learner permit or driving licence do 
not need to submit a medical report with their application during the period 
beginning on the 1 August 2020 and ending on 31 December 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [265]
